```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Cyber Input Variable Mapping
Height_I = 5

def reset_scene():
    scene.delete()  # delete the current scene
    scene.caption = ""  # clear any previous captions
    scene.autoscale = False
    scene.forward = vector(-0.5, -0.3, -1)
    scene.range = 10

    # Object Motion & Parameter Settings
    ground = box(pos=vector(0, -Height_I, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)  # ground
    ball = sphere(pos=vector(-10, 0, 0), radius=1, color=color.red, make_trail=True)  # ball

    v0 = 5  # initial velocity
    g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity
    t = 0  # time
    dt = 0.01  # time step

    ball.velocity = vector(v0, 0, 0)  # initial velocity vector

    while ball.pos.x < 10:
        rate(100)
        ball.pos.x += ball.velocity.x * dt
        ball.velocity.y -= g * dt
        ball.pos.y += ball.velocity.y * dt

        if ball.pos.y <= -Height_I:
            ball.velocity.y = -ball.velocity.y

reset_scene()
```

This code creates a VPython animation for the Horizontal Projectile Motion experiment with the specified settings and variable mapping for `initial_height`. When the value of `Height_I` changes, the animation will rerun with the updated initial height.

from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
canvas.width = 700
canvas.height = 400

# Cyber Input Variable Mapping Information
Angle_I = 5

def pendulum_motion():
    angle = Angle_I * pi/180
    L = 1  # Length of the pendulum
    g = 9.81  # Acceleration due to gravity
    omega = sqrt(g/L)
    T = 2*pi/omega
    
    ball = sphere(pos=vector(L*sin(angle), -L*cos(angle), 0), radius=0.1, color=color.red)
    string = cylinder(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.02)
    
    t = 0
    dt = 0.01
    
    while t < T:
        rate(100)
        angle = Angle_I * cos(omega * t)
        ball.pos = vector(L*sin(angle), -L*cos(angle), 0)
        string.axis = ball.pos
        t += dt

pendulum_motion()

from vpython import *

canvas(width=700, height=400)

ground = box(pos=vec(0, -5, 0), size=vec(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)
ball = sphere(pos=vec(-9, 0, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.red)
velocity = 5
gravity = 9.81

def update_position():
    ball.pos.x = -9
    ball.pos.y = Friction_I.value
    ball.v = vec(velocity, 0, 0)

def reset():
    ball.v = vec(velocity, 0, 0)
    ball.pos.y = Friction_I.value

def start():
    while ball.pos.y > -5:
        rate(100)
        ball.v.y -= gravity * 0.01
        ball.pos += ball.v * 0.01
        if ball.pos.y < -5:
            ball.v.y *= -1

Friction_I = slider(min=-10, max=10, value=5, bind=update_position)
button(text='Start', bind=start)
button(text='Reset', bind=reset)

update_position()
